description: From Old French querelos, from Late Latin querulōsus, from Latin querulus, from queror (“I complain”).

adjectives.description: querulous (comparative more querulous, superlative most querulous)

entries.meaning: Often complaining; suggesting a complaint in expression; fretful, whining.
examples: The nights were now cold, gemmed with a multitude of bright stars, uncanny with the querulous wail of coyotes and the occasional deep voices of wolves.
